importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The article does not specify an actual release date for the series, only that it is 'coming soon' and will run for eight episodes.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The series begins in the 1930s and spans through the 1950s, exploring the rise of the Kennedy family during a pivotal era in American history, including the formative years of John F. Kennedy's life.

keyTakeAways: Netflix is launching a new drama series titled 'Kennedy' based on Fredrik Logevall's biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'.
The series stars Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr., and explores the family’s triumphs and tragedies across generations.
The show begins in the 1930s, tracing the rise of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their nine children, including Jack Kennedy, who struggles to escape the shadow of his older brother.
The series is not related to the upcoming Ryan Murphy-produced show about JFK Jr.
The showrunner Sam Shaw describes the Kennedy story as a modern American mythology, offering insight into both the family’s history and broader cultural developments.
The series is expected to run for eight episodes and has not yet been assigned a release date.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is cast as Joe Kennedy, Sr., the patriarch of the Kennedy family, lending his star power to a major historical drama.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He authored the source biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956', which serves as the basis for the series.

namedEntities.name: JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is the primary source material for the series, providing historical context and narrative depth to the Kennedy family's rise.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is responsible for the creative direction and narrative framing of the series, emphasizing its cultural and historical significance.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: 35th U.S. President, son of Joe Kennedy, Sr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is a central figure in the Kennedy family story, representing both political triumph and tragic end.

namedEntities.name: JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Son of John F. Kennedy, who died in a plane crash in 1999
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His death, along with his wife and sister-in-law, is cited as part of the Kennedy family's tragic legacy and the so-called 'Kennedy curse'.

namedEntities.name: Ryan Murphy
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is associated with a different upcoming series about JFK Jr., which helps differentiate the new Netflix series from that one.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Netflix is launching a new drama series titled 'Kennedy', based on Fredrik Logevall's biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956', set to star Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr. The show, beginning in the 1930s, chronicles the rise of the Kennedy family, focusing on the struggles and triumphs of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their children, including Jack Kennedy. The series, which runs for eight episodes, aims to present the Kennedys not just as political icons but as a living American myth — offering insights into both historical events and the cultural trajectory of the United States. It is distinct from the upcoming Ryan Murphy-produced series about JFK Jr., and while the exact release date has not been announced, the narrative underscores the enduring legacy and tragic history of one of America’s most influential families.
title: Netflix Announces New Kennedy Family Series Starring Michael Fassbender
